div.div: The mission of the Hooksett School District is to develop a community of learners who are intellectually curious, resourceful, and respectful of self and others. Academic achievement, through constantly improving standards, is the District’s highest priority.

section.h3: Hooksett School District NewsView All posts from Hooksett School District News

h3.a: School Board to Meet Via Video Conferencing

li.p:
The Hooksett School Board will be holding a remote meeting via ZOOM on Tuesday, April 21, 2020, commencing at 6:00 p.m
ZOOM will be the platform used to run the meeting for the Board. It can be accessed by doing the following:
You will be able to listen to the meeting by phone by...

h3.a: Governor Extends Distance Learning Until End of School Year

li.p:
Dear Auburn, Candia and Hooksett Families;
Today, as many of you may have heard, Governor Sununu extended remote learning for schools through the end of the school year. We will continue to have April vacation, April 27th - May 1st, as planned. There will be no distance learning during this time....

h3.a: School Board to Meet Via Video Conferencing

li.p:
The Hooksett School Board will be holding a remote meeting via ZOOM on Tuesday, April 7, 2020, commencing at 6:00 p.m.
ZOOM will be the platform used to run the meeting for the Board. It can be accessed by doing the following:
You will be able to listen to the meeting by...

br.h3: David R. Cawley Middle School NewsView All posts from David R. Cawley Middle School News

li.p:
Please watch the Morning Announcement for Friday, April 24, 2020
Today is Friday, April 24, 2020. Students will go to their teachers' Google Classrooms and click on the Zoom link for Math, Science and UA 1 classes today. Please turn on the video so that your teachers can...

li.p:
Click the link for a video from the HMS Staff & Community. (same video, 2 formats)
YouTube Link:
https://youtu.be/l6iwNVeCfWE

br.h3: Fred C. Underhill Elementary School NewsView All posts from Fred C. Underhill Elementary School News

h3.a: Last Day of School Rescheduled to June 2, 2020

li.p:
Dear Parents,
Last night at the Hooksett School Board meeting, the Hooksett School Board voted and approved June 2, 2020 as the last day of school for all students and staff.
I am in the process of developing plans for families to drop off specific materials and to pick up personal items....

div.p:
Address:
35 Main Street, Hooksett, NH
Hours of Operation:
Monday: 10am-noon
Tuesday: 2pm-4pm
Wednesday: 9am-noon, 4pm-6pm
Thursday: 2pm-4:30pm
Friday: 10am-noon
Saturday & Sunday: closed at this time
Contact Information:
Cindy Nusbaum: (603) 518-5047 x5023
Food Pantry: (603) 485-7222

p.span: The Hooksett School District is committed to ensuring that persons with disabilities can access information on the District’s website. If you would like additional assistance or have any concerns in accessing the content on this website, please contact Daniel Roma at (603) 518-5047 or email accessibility@sau15.net.
